captions.text:
It's certainly a phenomenon
in all walks of life.

Well, at one point,
you've got it.

Then you lose it,
and it's gone forever.

Georgie best, for example,
had it, lost it,

Or david bowie,
or lou reed.

Lou reed? Some of his
solo stuff's not bad.

No, it's not bad, but it's not
great either, is it?

And in your heart,
you kind of know

That although
it sounds all right,

Okay, okay, so what is the point
you're trying to make?

[ sighs ] all I am
trying to do, mark,

That "the name of the rose"
is merely a blip

On an otherwise uninterrupted
downward trajectory.

I don't rate that
at all.

So we all get old, we can't hack
it anymore, and that's it?

<i>[ imitating sean connery ]</i>
<i>do you see the beast?</i>

[ imitating connery ]
clear enough, miss moneypenny.

This should present
no significant problems.

For a vegetarian, rents,
you're a fucking evil shot.

title: Trainspotting (4/12) Movie CLIP - Sick Boy's Theory of Life (1996) HD

comments.author: josef x

comments.text:
There seem to be a lot of people here talking about Star Wars and various 
other productions these dudes have been involved with.  Those things 
probably have their own clips and chat where you can hang out and 
mouth-fart.  Maybe it would save you time and us our sanity.  

Anyway, this movie came out the year I graduated high school.  I rented it 
on VHS from Blockbuster and watched it probably five times.  I never did 
return it, so that's probably why my credit is so shitty.

This is one of two films that I watched before I read the book.  The other 
was Requiem for a Dream.  The latter book experience was kind of fucked for 
doing so.  Trainspotting, on the other hand, wasn't.  In the edition I 
bought there was a dictionary of Scotch argot at the end.  It's a microcosm 
you can get lost in, and I recommend everyone do so at least once.﻿
